issue.subject: Add dashbord features to CORE
issue.description:
The aim is to get a better and transversal vision of activities on the SDI portal for administrator and users.
The idea is to add features to the CORE that will propose a kind of dashboard for :

- general figures (number of users, of furnitures,...)
- SHOP figures (number of request, delivered products,...)
- CATALOG figures (number of metadata, private/public,...)
- PROXY figures (users, amount of Mo transferred, number of services relayd,...)
- etc...

An idea is to build a plug-in mechanism in CORE, so that for each new component installation (i.e. SHOP, CATALOG,...), new features will be added to the CORE dashboard.

To be discussed... particularly the relationship/agenda with EasySDI V2 release issues have to be addressed.

journals.notes:
We did some job on this on Joomla! 2.5 in order to add such features in EasySDI V3.

I will present them during a coming PSC meeting.

Dashboard fetaures were presented during our last PSC meeting. Lot of enthusiasm !

!http://forge.easysdi.org/attachments/527/COM_DASHBOARD_ADMINISTRATION3.png!

We now need to discuss the strategy for inserting it in the EasySDI V3 (new component or Core ?).

The feature is under developpement and is now waiting for stabilized the new EasyDI datamodel to be finished.

Mains concepts were validating during the two-days workshop on the 27th and 28th of june:

- the new EasySDI backend HOME will have its own indicators. All of them will be published/unpublished via modules and plugins (Joomla standard mechanism).
- EasySDI package will be available with a set of default indicators that do not need any Java servlet installation or third party apps.
- The HOME will be fully customizable via Modules, meaning an administrator will be able to add any third party modules (for example module "connected users") in the panel.
- Advanced dashboard will be available via another componant DASHBOARD (not CORE) - description here #623

Indicators to add in the EasysDI HOME will be as follow (as needed by SI17) :

- average time for request treatment (global)
- # of awaiting request (orders/
- # of metadata (ressources)
- # of downloadable data
- # of downloaded products (global)
- # of extracted data (global)
- # of orderable data (global)


To be done later in the DASHBOARD screens (with filter per period, organism,...), need the servlets : 

- # of uploaded products (per organism)
- # of extracted data (per organism)

This feature was added during beta release of easysdi V4 and will be availaible in stable v4 release.

This ticket can be closed.
